captions.text:
>>AND FOR OUR LAST ITEM
UP FOR BID TODAY WE HAVE

VAN GOGH'S STARRY NIGHT.
THE BIDING WILL START AT 100 MILLION DOLLARS.

DO I SEE 100 MILLION?
100, DO I SEE 125?

200?
175 GOING ONCE.

>>ONE BILLION DOLLARS.
>>OH MY.

WELL I DON'T THINK ANYONE IS GOING TO OUT--
>>TWO BILLION.

>>OH, WELL IN THAT CASE.
>>SIX KILLION DOLLARS.

>>BUT SIR THAT IS NOT A REAL NUMBER.
>>SEVEN KILLION.

>>WHAT?
>>TEN HUNDRED THOUSAND KILLION PESOS.

>>WHAT IS THE EXCHANGE RATE ON PESO-
NO THESE ARE STILL FAKE NUMBERS.

>>I WILL GIVE YOU MY FIRST-BORN CHILD.
>>WE ARE ONLY ACCEPTING MONEY.

>>I WILL GIVE YOU MY PERSONAL ISLAND.
>>STILL NOT MONEY.

>>I WILL GIVE YOU RHODE ISLAND.
>>YOU CAN'T- YOU CAN'T OWN RHODE ISLAND!

>>I CAN OWN WHATEVER I LIKE.
I'M A KILLIONAIRE.

>>WELL SO AM I.
>>OKAY BY ONE GET ONE FREE!

TWO CHILDREN!
>>STILL NOT ACCEPTING CHILDREN.

DOES ANYONE WANT TO BID SOMETHING SERIOUS?
>>I WILL GIVE YOU TWO VAN GOGHS FOR ONE VAN GOGH!
>>THAT'S TEMPTING-- >>WHY WOULD YOU WANT

TWO VAN GOGHS WHEN 
YOU COULD HAVE THREE CHILDREN

PEOPLE!
THREE CHILDREN!

>>THIS AUCTION IS TO RAISE MONEY,
NOT CHILDREN.

ONLY MONEY.
>>VERY WELL.

>>THANK YOU.
>>BUT, I WILL GIVE YOU VAN GOGH'S ACTUAL

EAR.
[GASPS OF SURPRISE AND AWE]

>>I'LL GIVE YOU THE REST OF HIM.
[QUIET GASPS AND SCREAMS] [SLOW CLAPPING]
[SLOW CLAPPING]

>>WELL BID SIR.
>>THANK YOU, THANK YOU.

>>CONGRATULATIONS.
>>NO- >>THANK YOU EVERYONE.

>>THAT'S NOT HOW IT WORKS.
NO PLEASE, NO.

comments.text:
Why on earth would someone pay over a million dollars on a painting? I 
can't imagine going over a hundred dollars, if it was really awesome, I 
might go as high as 200, but that would be highly unlikely. I guess I am 
not a big art fan. This sketch is still funny though.﻿
